title: 110_s1891
content: IMMUNITY FOR REPORTS OF SUSPECTED TERRORIST ACTIVITY OR SUSPICIOUS BEHAVIOR AND RESPONSE. Immunity is granted to individuals who report suspected terrorist activity or suspicious behavior in good faith and based on reasonable suspicion. They are protected from civil liability under any law for making such reports. However, this immunity does not apply if the report is known to be false or made with reckless disregard for the truth. Additionally, immunity is also provided for the response to these reports. Immunity is granted to individuals who report suspected terrorist activity in good faith. They are protected from civil liability under any law for making such reports. However, this immunity does not apply if the report is known to be false or made with reckless disregard for the truth. Authorized officials responding to covered activity also have qualified immunity from civil liability for their actions. Authorized officials who observe or receive reports of covered activity and take reasonable action in good faith are granted qualified immunity from civil liability. This immunity extends to federal, state, and local laws, except in cases where the report is known to be false or made recklessly. Authorized officials described in subsection (d)(1)(A) are immune from civil liability under Federal, State, and local law if they take reasonable action in good faith to respond to reported activity. This immunity does not affect their ability to assert any other defense, privilege, or immunity available to them. In good faith, authorized officials are immune from civil liability when responding to reported activity. They can still assert other defenses or privileges available to them. If found immune, they can recover reasonable costs and attorney fees from the plaintiff. Authorized officials are immune from civil liability and can recover costs and attorney fees if found immune. "Authorized official" includes employees or agents responsible for security in passenger transportation systems. Authorized official refers to individuals such as employees or agents of passenger transportation systems, Department of Homeland Security, Department of Transportation, Department of Justice, or law enforcement officers at the federal, state, or local level with security responsibilities. The term "covered activity" refers to any suspicious transaction, activity, or occurrence involving a passenger transportation system or vehicle that may indicate a potential violation of the law. This includes individuals who may be engaging in or preparing to engage in illegal activities related to passenger transportation systems. The term "covered activity" refers to suspicious transactions, activities, or occurrences involving a passenger transportation system or vehicle that may indicate a violation of law related to threats to passenger safety, security, or terrorism. Passenger transportation refers to the transportation of passengers. The term "covered activity" refers to suspicious transactions, activities, or occurrences involving a passenger transportation system or vehicle that may indicate a violation of law related to threats to passenger safety, security, or terrorism. Passenger transportation includes public transportation, over-the-road bus transportation, school bus transportation, and intercity passenger rail transportation. Passenger transportation includes public transportation, over-the-road bus transportation, school bus transportation, intercity passenger rail transportation, and passenger vessel transportation. Passenger transportation includes intercity passenger rail, passenger vessel, waterborne transportation service, and air transportation of passengers. The term "passenger transportation system" refers to an entity organized to provide passenger transportation using vehicles, including the infrastructure. The term "vehicle" is defined in section 1992(16) of title 18, United States Code. The transportation system is an entity providing passenger transportation using vehicles and infrastructure. The effective date of this section is upon enactment and applies to activities and claims thereafter.
